meanings.definition: A feeling of offense or resentment.
meanings.sent1: She was in a dudgeon after being left out of the team.
meanings.sent2: His dudgeon was evident when his idea was dismissed without consideration.
meanings.sent3: Despite her dudgeon, she managed to keep a smile on her face.
meanings.sent4: The dudgeon in his voice was unmistakable as he expressed his disappointment.
meanings.sent5: The dudgeon in the room was palpable, making everyone uncomfortable.

meanings.definition: A wooden handle of a dagger or sword.
meanings.sent1: The knight gripped the dudgeon tightly as he charged into battle.
meanings.sent2: The intricate carvings on the dudgeon made it a prized possession.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally dropped the dudgeon, causing a loud clatter.
meanings.sent4: The dudgeon gleamed in the sunlight, reflecting the craftsmanship.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the dudgeon added balance to the weapon.
